calendar-event-select-committee.subject: (i) Financial institutions - too important to fail? (ii) Audit and accounting
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: (i) John Varley, Chief Executive, Barclays (ii) Association of Chartered Certified Accountants, Institute of Chartered Accountants of Scotland, Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales, and the Financial Reporting Council (at 10.45am)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Air Quality
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Transport Research Laboratory; Environmental Research Group, Kings College London (at 10.50am); Department for Transport (at 11.30am)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Further Education funding and the Skills Funding Agency
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: At 10.30: Young People’s Learning Agency and Skills Funding Agency At 11.30: Kevin Brennan MP, Minister for education, Skills, Apprenticeships and Consumer Affairs, Department for business, Innovation and Skills

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: The Government’s Approach to Crime Prevention
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Jill Dando Institute for Crime Science; Maria Eagle MP, Minister of State, Ministry of Justice, and Vernon Coaker MP, Minister for Schools and Learners, Department for Children, Schools and Families (at 11.00 a.m.); Safer Sutton Partnership, and Councillor Lord Tope CBE (at 11.30am); Cricket for Change (at 12 noon)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Wales and Whitehall
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Legal Services Commission; Sir Gus O’Donnell KCB, Cabinet Secretary and Head of the Home Civil Service (at 11.15am); Rt Hon Peter Hain MP, Secretary of State for Wales (at 12.00 noon)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Afghanistan and The Green Paper
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Rt Hon Bob Ainsworth MP, Secretary of State, Jonathan Day, Director General Security Policy, and Lieutenant General Simon Mayall, Deputy Chief of Defence Staff (Operations), Ministry of Defence
